metadata.description: Command Scripts event fields for S1QL 2.0 queries

cmdScript.applicationName.description: Name of application that ran command script

cmdScript.content.description: The content of the executed command script. Limited up to first 65KB.

cmdScript.isComplete.description: Marks if the command script content is complete or truncated due to size limit. The maximal size limit is 65KB.

cmdScript.originalSize.description: The size (in bytes) of the complete command script

cmdScript.sha256.description: The SHA256 hash of the complete command script. This value can be used in Exclusions.

src.process.cmdline.description: Command line arguments sent to the source process. For example: In the command line "runc init" the source process runc is activated. src.process.cmdline will be "runc init" In the command line "C:\Windows\system32\svchost.exe -k wsappx -p -s AppXSvc" the source process svchost.exe is activated. src.process.cmdline will be "C:\Windows\system32\svchost.exe -k wsappx -p -s AppXSvc"

metadata.description: Cross Process event fields for S1QL 2.0 queries

tgt.process.accessRights.description: Type of access granted to process by cross process

tgt.process.activeContent.hash.description: Active Content SHA1 for target process

tgt.process.activeContent.id.description: Active Content file unique ID for target process

tgt.process.activeContent.path.description: Active Content file path of source process was the target of the event

tgt.process.activeContent.signedStatus.description: Active Content file signed status for target process

tgt.process.activeContentType.description: Active Content type of target process

tgt.process.cmdline.description: Full command line sent with the target process

tgt.process.image.binaryIsExecutable.description: Is binary backing the target process an executable

tgt.process.isNative64Bit.description: Is target process compiled natively for 64-Bit or runs as WoW

tgt.process.isRedirectCmdProcessor.description: Is interpreter for target process with stdout redirection

tgt.process.isStorylineRoot.description: Indicates if the target process is the root of Storyline

tgt.process.name.description: The file name of the target process. When process A creates process B, the target process name in the process creation event will be of process B.

tgt.process.publisher.description: Publisher that digitally signed the binary being invoked as part of the target process

tgt.process.reasonSignatureInvalid.description: Indicates the reason the target process signature is not valid

tgt.process.relation.description: Relationship between source process and target process

tgt.process.sessionId.description: ID of the terminal (cmd, shell, other) session of target process

tgt.process.startTime.description: Start time of target process. Format: epoch time (milliseconds since 1.1.1970), Timezone: UTC

tgt.process.user.description: Username under which target process ran

tgt.process.verifiedStatus.description: Verification status of signature of the target process

metadata.description: DNS event fields for S1QL 2.0 queries

event.dns.protocol.description: The protocol used in the DNS request

event.dns.provider.description: The provider used by the agent to collect the DNS event telemetry

event.dns.request.description: Domain name of the resource requested by the host

event.dns.response.description: The data in the DNS response describing the resource. I.e. the IP address, DNS, type, and so on.

event.dns.responseCode.description: The DNS response code returned by the DNS server

event.dns.transportProtocol.description: The transport protocol used in the DNS request

metadata.description: Driver event fields for S1QL 2.0 queries

driver.certificate.signature.algorithm.description: Driver Certificate Signature Algorithm is the digest algorithm (hash function) used to calculate the driver certificate signature. SHA1 or SHA256 are most commonly used.

driver.certificate.signature.hash.description: Driver Certificate Signature is a SHA1 or SHA256 hash used to identify the driver certificate

driver.certificate.thumbprint.description: Driver Certificate Thumbprint is a SHA1 or SHA256 hash used to identify the driver certificate

driver.certificate.thumbprintAlgorithm.description: Driver Certificate Thumbprint Algorithm is the digest algorithm (hash function) used to calculate the driver certificate thumbprint. SHA1 or SHA256 are most commonly used.

driver.dropper.process.storyline.id.description: The Storyline ID associated with the process that wrote the driver file to the disk. Used to track the storyline of the driver dropper to look for the full list of IOCs associated with the driver.

driver.peSha1.description: SHA1 Hash of the Driver PE File

driver.peSha256.description: SHA256 Hash of the Driver PE File

driver.registryKeyPath.description: The registry key path where the driver registered itself.

driver.serviceName.description: The service name of the driver

driver.startType.description: Driver Load Start Type determines when a driver will be loaded, either during or after the system starts.

metadata.description: Files event fields for S1QL 2.0 queries

k8sCluster.containerId.description: Container ID. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.containerImage.description: Container image. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.containerLabels.description: Container labels. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.containerName.description: Container name. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.controllerLabels.description: Kubernetes controller labels. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.controllerName.description: Kubernetes controller name. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.controllerType.description: Kubernetes controller type. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.name.description: Kubernetes cluster name. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.namespace.description: Kubernetes namespace. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.namespaceLabels.description: Kubernetes namespace labels. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.nodeName.description: Kubernetes node name. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.podLabels.description: Kubernetes pod labels. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.podName.description: Kubernetes pod name. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

src.process.image.binaryIsExecutable.description: Is binary backing source process an executable

src.process.image.description.description: The description of the file taken from version information. For example, if the image is "cmd.exe", this would be "Windows Command Processor"

src.process.image.internalName.description: The "internal name" field from the process's image resource.

src.process.image.originalFileName.description: The "Original filename" field taken from the process's image properties.

src.process.image.productName.description: The "Product Name" field taken from the process's image properties.

src.process.image.productVersion.description: The "Product version" field taken from the process's image properties.

src.process.image.type.description: The source process's image file type

src.process.signedStatus.description: Verifies the process validity and integrity. Unsigned processes may pose a security risk.

task.cluster.description: Cluster name. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

task.ecsVersion.description: Task Ecs Version. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

task.serviceArn.description: Task service ARN. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

task.serviceName.description: Task service name. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

task.tags.description: Task tags. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

task.taskArn.description: Task ARN. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

task.taskAvailabilityZone.description: Task Availability Zone:. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

task.taskDefinitionArn.description: Task definition ARN. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

task.taskDefinitionFamily.description: Task definition family. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

task.taskDefinitionRevision.description: Task definition revision. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

tgt.file.creationTime.description: Date and Time of File Creation. Format: epoch time (milliseconds since 1.1.1970), Timezone: UTC

tgt.file.isDirectory.description: Indicates whether the target file is a directory.

tgt.file.modificationTime.description: Date and time file was modified. Format: epoch time (milliseconds since 1.1.1970), Timezone: UTC

tgt.file.name.description: The target file name. For example, if the file path is a\b\c.txt then this field will be c.txt

tgt.file.origin.creationMethod.description: Type of action that spawned the file

tgt.file.origin.creatorProcess.name.description: The process name that spawned the file

tgt.file.origin.creatorProcess.uid.description: The process UID that spawned the file

tgt.file.origin.locationPath.description: Source path for copied files, or URL for downloaded files

tgt.file.origin.locationType.description: If file was copied, describes the source file's location. If file was downloaded, describes which program created it

tgt.file.originalFileName.description: The "Original filename" field taken from the file's properties.

tgt.file.owner.name.description: The name of the process that owns this file.

tgt.file.owner.userSid.description: The Security Descriptor (SID) of the user that the process that owns this file is using.

tgt.file.path.description: The full path of the target file including the file name

tgt.file.productName.description: The "Product Name" field from the file's properties.

tgt.file.productVersion.description: The "Product version" field from the file's properties.

tgt.file.publisher.description: The entity that signed the target file.

tgt.file.signature.isValid.description: Indicates whether the file's digital signature is valid.

tgt.file.signatureInvalidReason.description: Indicates why the file signature was deemed invalid

metadata.description: Indicators event fields for S1QL 2.0 queries

indicator.category.description: Category name of the behavioral indicator. A full listing of indicator categories can be found here: https://community.sentinelone.com/s/article/000006183

indicator.description.description: Description of the behavioral indicator. A full list of behavioral indicator descriptions can be found here: https://community.sentinelone.com/s/article/000006183

indicator.metadata.description: Contains metadata information relevant to the behavioral indicator. For example, for the ServiceCreated indicator, this field contains the name of the service For Process related indicators, this field contains additional information about the process such as process name and process ID For the WmiQueryAntiVm indicator, this field contains the query

indicator.name.description: Friendly name of the behavioral indicator. Behavioral indicator descriptions can be found here: https://community.sentinelone.com/s/article/000006183

metadata.description: Logins event fields for S1QL 2.0 queries

event.login.accountDomain.description: Domain or computer name for which login attempt was performed

event.login.accountName.description: The name of the account that reported information about the logon event. On Windows, this value is collected from logon event SubjectUserName field.

event.login.accountSid.description: Security identifier (SID) of the account that attempted to login. The SID is a data structure of variable length that identifies the user account. Every account on a network is issued a unique SID when the account is first created.

event.login.isAdministratorEquivalent.description: Indicates login events for accounts with administrator privileges. Based on the ElevatedToken field in Windows logon events. If "True", then the session this event represents is elevated and has administrator privileges.

event.login.sessionId.description: Session ID of the successful login

event.login.tgt.domainName.description: The name of the Domain the user is associated with in the login event.

event.login.tgt.user.name.description: The name of the user that logged in.

event.login.tgt.userSid.description: The Security Descriptor (SID) of the user that logged in.

event.login.type.description: Type of login which was performed. The value is based on Microsoft security logon types. Note that the logon event type NewCredentials is called NETWORK_CREDENTIALS.

event.login.userName.description: The username used in login event. On Windows, this value is collected from logon event TargetUserName field.

event.logout.tgt.domainName.description: The name of the Domain the user is associated with in the logout event.

event.logout.tgt.user.name.description: The name of the user that logged out.

event.logout.tgt.userSid.description: The Security Descriptor (SID) of the user that logged out.

event.logout.type.description: The type of login which was used for the original login. The possible values are: 2 - Interactive login from the physical device. 3 - Network - a user or computer logged in from the network. 4 - Batch - logged on by a batch server, the user was likely not directly involved. 5 - Service - A service was started by the SCM, generating a login event for the service's user. 6 - doesn't exist. 7 - A locked but already logged-in computer was unlocked. 8 - NetworkCleartext - Similar to network, except the user's password was passed to the authentication package in plain text instead of passing the hash. 9 - NewCredentials - A caller cloned its current token and specified new credentials for outbound connections. The new logon session has the same local identity, but uses different credentials for other network connections. 10 - Remote Interactive - A login via Terminal Service or remote desktop (RDP). 11 - CachedInteractive - The credentials used are locally stored network credentials. The domain controller was not contacted to verify the credentials. More details on all can be found here: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/it-pro/windows-10/security/threat-protection/auditing/basic-audit-logon-events

src.endpoint.ip.address.description: IP address of the machine performing the login attempt

src.endpoint.name.description: The name of the source machine the user is associated with in the login event.

metadata.description: Modules event fields for S1QL 2.0 queries
Network Actions event fields for S1QL 2.0 queries

dst.ip.address.description: IP address of destination for the network request

dst.port.number.description: Port number of destination of the network request

event.network.direction.description: Direction of the network connection event. Incoming network connection direction originate from another device to the SentinelOne protected endpoint, while outgoing network connection direction originate from the SentinelOne protected endpoint to another device.

event.network.protocolName.description: Protocol name per IANA well known ports distribution

k8sCluster.nodeName.description: Kubernetes node name. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.podLabels.description: Kubernetes pod labels. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

k8sCluster.podName.description: Kubernetes pod name. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

task.cluster.description: Cluster name. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

task.ecsVersion.description: Task Ecs Version. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

task.serviceArn.description: Task service ARN. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

task.serviceName.description: Task service name. Will be presented only for events triggered on K8s Agents.

osSrc.process.parent.image.sha256.description: SHA256 of process that created the OS source process (as attributed by the OS)

osSrc.process.parent.image.uid.description: Image UID of the OS source process parent

osSrc.process.parent.sessionId.description: ID of terminal (cmd, shell, other) session of the process that created the OS source process (as attributed by the OS)

osSrc.process.parent.signedStatus.description: Signature status of process that created the OS source process (as attributed by the OS)

osSrc.process.parent.startTime.description: Start time of parent of the OS source process. Format: epoch time (milliseconds since 1.1.1970), Timezone: UTC

osSrc.process.parent.storyline.id.description: Storyline ID of the process that created the OS source process (as attributed by the OS)

osSrc.process.parent.uid.description: Unique ID of process that created the OS source process (as attributed by the OS)

osSrc.process.parent.user.description: Username under which the process that created the OS source process ran (as attributed by the OS)

osSrc.process.parent.userSid.description: The Security Descriptor (SID) of the user the parent process is running under.

osSrc.process.pid.description: PID for source process (as attributed by the OS)

osSrc.process.publisher.description: Publisher that signed binary invoked as part of the process (as attributed by the OS)

osSrc.process.reasonSignatureInvalid.description: Reason process (as attributed by the OS) signature invalid

osSrc.process.sessionId.description: ID of the terminal (cmd, shell, other) session of source process (as attributed by the OS)

osSrc.process.signedStatus.description: Signature status of source process (as attributed by the OS)

osSrc.process.startTime.description: Start time of source process (as attributed by the OS). Format: epoch time (milliseconds since 1.1.1970), Timezone: UTC

osSrc.process.storyline.id.description: Storyline ID of the source process (as attributed by the OS)

osSrc.process.subsystem.description: Subsystem of source process (as attributed by the OS)

osSrc.process.uid.description: Unique ID of source process (as attributed by the the OS)

osSrc.process.user.description: Username under which source process (attributed by the OS) ran

osSrc.process.userSid.description: The Security Decriptor (SID) of the user the process is running under. For example, a service may run as "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" with the SID "S-1-5-18"

osSrc.process.verifiedStatus.description: Verification status of process signature (as attributed by the OS)

src.process.activeContent.hash.description: Active Content SHA1 for source process

src.process.activeContent.id.description: Active Content file unique ID for source process

src.process.activeContent.path.description: Active Content file path for source process

src.process.activeContent.signedStatus.description: Active Content file signed status for source process

src.process.activeContentType.description: Active Content type of source process

src.process.childProcCount.description: Count of the child processes as attributed by the OS.

src.process.cmdline.description: Command line arguments sent to the source process. For example: In the command line "runc init" the source process runc is activated. src.process.cmdline will be "runc init" In the command line "C:\Windows\system32\svchost.exe -k wsappx -p -s AppXSvc" the source process svchost.exe is activated. src.process.cmdline will be "C:\Windows\system32\svchost.exe -k wsappx -p -s AppXSvc"

src.process.eUserName.description: Effective Username under which the process ran

src.process.eUserUid.description: EUID of the account that executed the source process

src.process.image.origin.creationMethod.description: Type of action that spawned the file

src.process.image.origin.creatorProcess..description: The process name that spawned the file
The process UID that spawned the file

src.process.image.origin.locationPath.description: Source path for copied files, or URL for downloaded files

src.process.image.origin.locationType.description: If file was copied, describes the source file's location. If file was downloaded, describes which program created it

src.process.image.size.description: The size of the source process's image in bytes.

src.process.image.uid.description: The process' image Uid. This is a unique identifier that is generated for each process.

src.process.indicatorBootConfigurationUp.description: Count of indicators - Boot Configuration Update

src.process.isNative64Bit.description: Indicates if the process is 32-bit or 64-bit

src.process.isRedirectCmdProcessor.description: Indicates if interpreter is with stdout redirection

src.process.isStorylineRoot.description: Indicates if process is the root of Storyline

src.process.lUserName.description: Login Username under which the process ran

src.process.lUserUid.description: LUID of the account that executed the source process

src.process.name.description: The file name of the process originating the event

src.process.netConnCount.description: Count of incoming and outgoing network connections

src.process.parent.image.sha256.description: SHA256 of process that created this process

tgt.process.image.binaryIsExecutable.description: Is binary backing the target process an executable

The process UID that spawned the file

tgt.process.image.size.description: The size of the target process's file in bytes.

tgt.process.image.uid.description: The target process' image Uid. This is a unique identifier that is generated for each process.

tgt.process.isNative64Bit.description: Is target process compiled natively for 64-Bit or runs as WoW

tgt.process.isRedirectCmdProcessor.description: Is interpreter for target process with stdout redirection

tgt.process.isStorylineRoot.description: Indicates if the target process is the root of Storyline

tgt.process.lUserUid.description: LUID of the account that executed the target process

tgt.process.name.description: The file name of the target process. When process A creates process B, the target process name in the process creation event will be of process B.

tgt.process.parent.image.type.description: The target process parents' file type, such as PE, LNK, PYTHON, JS, PDF, etc.

tgt.process.publisher.description: Publisher that digitally signed the binary being invoked as part of the target process

tgt.process.reasonSignatureInvalid.description: Indicates the reason the target process signature is not valid

tgt.process.userSid.description: The Security Descriptor (SID) of the user that was used to execute the process.

tgt.process.verifiedStatus.description: Verification status of signature of the target process

metadata.description: Registry event fields for S1QL 2.0 queries

registry.export.path.description: The path to which a registry key was exported.

registry.import.path.description: The path from which the registry key was imported.

registry.keyPath.description: Full path location of the Registry Key entry

registry.keyUid.description: Unique ID of registry key (as assigned by SentinelOne)

registry.oldValue.description: Registry previous value (in case of modification)

registry.oldValueFullSize.description: Registry previous full size (in case of modification)

registry.oldValueIsComplete.description: Was the previous registry value full size or was it truncated (in case of modification)

registry.oldValueType.description: Registry previous value type (in case of modification)

registry.owner.userSid.description: The Security Descriptor (SID) of the user/user group that owns the registry key.

registry.valueFullSize.description: Full size of registry value (in case it was truncated)

registry.valueIsComplete.description: Is the registry value full size or is it truncated

metadata.description: Scheduled Tasks event fields for S1QL 2.0 queries

task.name.description: Name of a scheduled task, as generated by the Host

task.path.description: Full path location of a scheduled task

task.triggerType.description: The reason this task was executed. 0 is Unknown. 1 means this is a recurring task executed every X time. 2 means the event this task waits on has happened. 3 means this is a task that was scheduled to be executed immediately after its creation. 5 means this task was triggered because the system was idle. 6 means it was executed on boot. 7 means the tasks is wired to trigger on user logon. 8 means "other" reason, similar to 0.

metadata.description: URL event fields for S1QL 2.0 queries

url.address.description: The full URL address accessed in the URL event

agent.uuid.description: Unique Identifier of the SentinelOne agent

endpoint.type.description: Machine type: server, laptop, desktop, Kubernetes Node

event.category.description: Event category groups event types related to a common object such as a process, file, driver, task, indicator, IP. For example, filtering on event.category = 'process' yields all events relating to process activity.

event.id.description: Unique SentinelOne identifier for the event

event.time.description: The time the event was created. Format: epoch time (milliseconds since 1.1.1970), Timezone: UTC

event.type.description: Type of operating system, application, network or user activity observed by the agent on the endpoint. Event types can include for example: Process events such as process creation or process termination Memory events such as memory read or write Driver events such as driver creation Registry events such as registry key renaming File events such as file creation, modification or deletion Network events such as IP connect, DNS resolved or URL Post Profile events such as Profile addition or removal. Event types are categorized to different groups by event.category

meta.event.name.description: Event name (PROCESSCREATION, FILECREATION, etc.) used for dataset filters

metadata.description: Complete query operators reference for SentinelOne Search and PowerQuery

operators.name: AND
operators.description: Combines query terms requiring all terms to match

operators.name: OR
operators.description: Combines query terms where at least one must match

operators.name: NOT
operators.description: Excludes events matching the specified term

operators.name: contains
operators.description: Retrieves events containing the search term (case-insensitive by default)
limitations: * contains cannot be used in Alerts

operators.name: matches
operators.description: Searches a field using regular expressions

operators.name: equals
operators.description: Selects events with a particular value

operators.name: not_equals
operators.description: Selects events that do not have a particular value

operators.name: greater_than
operators.description: Field value greater than specified value

operators.name: greater_than_or_equal
operators.description: Field value greater than or equal to specified value

operators.name: less_than
operators.description: Field value less than specified value

operators.name: less_than_or_equal
operators.description: Field value less than or equal to specified value

operators.name: wildcard
operators.description: Match events with any value in a field, or search all fields
limitations: * contains and * matches limited to PowerQuery initial filters

operators.name: in
operators.description: Search for numeric, boolean, and text values in a field
limitations: Cannot match null or missing fields
Quote text values, don't quote numeric/boolean

shortcuts.use_case: Quick search across all command line fields

shortcuts.description: any MD5, SHA1, or SHA256 field
shortcuts.use_case: Search all hash fields at once
Quick search across all storyline ID fields

operators.name: AND
operators.description: Combines query terms requiring all terms to match

operators.name: OR
operators.description: Combines query terms where at least one must match

operators.name: NOT
operators.description: Excludes events matching the specified term

operators.name: contains
operators.description: Retrieves events containing the search term (case-insensitive by default)
limitations: * contains cannot be used in Alerts

operators.name: matches
operators.description: Searches a field using regular expressions

operators.name: equals
operators.description: Selects events with a particular value

operators.name: not_equals
operators.description: Selects events that do not have a particular value

operators.name: greater_than
operators.description: Field value greater than specified value

operators.name: greater_than_or_equal
operators.description: Field value greater than or equal to specified value

operators.name: less_than
operators.description: Field value less than specified value

operators.name: less_than_or_equal
operators.description: Field value less than or equal to specified value

operators.name: wildcard
operators.description: Match events with any value in a field, or search all fields
limitations: * contains and * matches limited to PowerQuery initial filters

operators.name: in
operators.description: Search for numeric, boolean, and text values in a field
limitations: Cannot match null or missing fields
Quote text values, don't quote numeric/boolean

operators_boolean.description: Check if a boolean field is set as true
Check if a boolean field is set as false

operators_enum.description: Case sensitive compare string with list - string should match exactly one value in list
Negative compare string with list - string should match none of values in list

operators_string.description: Case sensitive contains function for comparing single value to single value
Case insensitive contains function for comparing single value to single value
Case insensitive contains function for comparing single value to single value
Negative case sensitive contains function for comparing single value to single value
Negative case sensitive contains function for comparing single value to single value
Negative case insensitive contains function for comparing single value to single value
Negative case insensitive contains function for comparing single value to single value
Case sensitive - single value string should start with string
Case insensitive - single value string should start with string
Case insensitive - single value string should start with string
Case sensitive - single value string should end with string
Case insensitive - single value string should end with string
Case insensitive - single value string should end with string
Negative case sensitive - single value string should not start with string
Negative case insensitive - single value string should not start with string
Negative case sensitive - single value string should not end with string
Negative case insensitive - single value string should not end with string
Regexp comparison - full string should match regexp expression
Not regexp comparison - string should match not regexp expression
Case sensitive compare string with list - string should match exactly one value in list
Negative compare string with list - string should match none of values in list
Case sensitive compare string with list - string should be contained within at least one value in list
Negative case sensitive compare string with list - string should be contained in none of the values in the list
Case insensitive compare string with list - string should match one value in list
Negative case insensitive compare string with list - string should match none of values in list
Case insensitive compare string with list - string should be contained with at least one value in list
Negative case insensitive compare string with list - string should be contained in none of the values in the list
Negative string comparison
Equal to
Partial string comparison - contains case sensitive
Negation of the binding operator =~
Check if a field exists
Check if a field is empty
Check if a field does not exist
Check if a field is not empty

shortcuts.description: any MD5, SHA1, or SHA256 field

metadata.description: Regular expressions reference for S1QL queries - compatible with traditional Java and Python libraries

escaping_rules.general: Double escaping required everywhere except $"regex" syntax in Search and PowerQueries
escaping_rules.shorthand_format: Regex does not need to be escaped. Example: $"\d+\.\d+\.\d+\.\d+"
escaping_rules.full_syntax: Regex must be escaped. Example: dst.ip.address matches "\\d+\\.\\d+\\.\\d+\\.\\d+"
escaping_rules.four_backslashes: In some cases, four backslashes (\\\\) are needed to properly escape. First backslash is the character (\), second escapes first, last two denote special character

restrictions.lookaheads: Positive and negative look aheads are restricted due to performance issues
restrictions.lookbehinds: Positive and negative look behinds are restricted due to performance issues

characters.legend: Word character: ASCII letter, digit or underscore
Whitespace character: space, tab, newline, carriage return, vertical tab
One character that is not a digit as defined by \d
One character that is not a word character as defined by \w
One character that is not a whitespace character as defined by \s
Match specific or ranges of unicode characters
Any character except line break (zero or more times)
A period (special character: needs to be escaped by backslash)
